did.unittitle: Merideth Wright Collection on University Heights
did.abstract: Merideth Wright attended the University Heights campus at New York University from Fall 1967-Spring 1969, and was involved in the inaugural class of the Metropolitan Leadership Program, which was devoted to interdisciplinary education. The Merideth Wright Collection on University Heights (dated circa 1967-1969) consists of photographs (prints, negatives, and contact sheets) of NYU students at the University Heights campus, including students at demonstrations on campus in 1968, and students attending the 1967 March on the Pentagon against the Vietnam War. The photographs document specific actions of student activism and organizing at the University Heights campus, as well as the broader context of campus activism in the late 1960s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Merideth Wright Collection on University Heights (dated circa 1967-1969) consists of photographs (prints, negatives, and contact sheets) of NYU students at the University Heights campus, including students at demonstrations on campus in 1968, and students attending the 1967 March on the Pentagon against the Vietnam War. The photographs document specific actions of student activism and organizing at the University Heights campus, as well as the broader context of campus activism in the late 1960s. The collection also includes a color photographic print of the view from Wright and Frances Pinter's dormitory room on the sixth floor of Silver Hall.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.
